sentences.cn: 她微笑着问：“我们不是很傻吗？”

sentences.en: "I found a mermaid."— 'Don't be daft. There's no such thing.'
sentences.cn: “我发现了一条美人鱼。”——“别说傻话了。哪有那种东西。”

sentences.en: Daft a brush - On Paul Gascoigne, part one.
sentences.cn: 像刷子一样没脑袋 --- 评加扎时如是道.

sentences.en: He's gone a bit daft ( in the head ), ie He has become slightly insane.
sentences.cn: 他 ( 头脑 ) 有些发痴.

sentences.en: He's not so daft as to listen to rumours.
sentences.cn: 他不会蠢到去听信谣言的。

sentences.en: I can lose a few pounds without resorting to daft diets.
sentences.cn: 我不用疯狂地节食也能减轻几磅。

sentences.en: In the middle age ,'Daft'were meant meek.
sentences.cn: 在中世纪, ‘ 达夫特’是可蔼,富有同情心的意思.

sentences.en: It's daft to play football in the rain!
sentences.cn: 冒雨踢足球可真太傻了!

sentences.en: Me, jealous? Don’t be daft (= that is a silly idea ) .
She’s as daft as a brush (= extremely silly ) .
Sometimes, admittedly, reactions are fairly daft.
The depth from waterline to vessel's bottom is called daft.
sentences.cn: 水线到船顶的浅度便吃火.

sentences.en: Tobin was a genius, but the Tobin tax was probably his one daft idea.
sentences.cn: 托宾是一位天才, 但托宾税大概是他唯一的蠢主意.

sentences.en: Well that's daft, I must say!
What a daft thing to say!
